ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] money problem
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey. I love D&D. We liked to role play and hack and loot. :-) luv, -Su Right about the time the game Dungeons & Dragons was first released. ... From:
ygData.messageBody:
Hey. I love D&D. We liked to role play and hack and loot. :-)
luv,
-Su

Right about the time the game "Dungeons & Dragons" was first released.

----- Original Message -----
From: John_Miewald@...
Sent: Wednesday, May 23, 2001 3:51 PM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] money problem



It seems to me that the only problem with twinking is that EQ has become
a
game about killing, levelling, and looting. If it were truly a
roleplaying
game, this would not even be an issue. If your main drive in the game
is
to get the bigger and better item (whatever it may be), you will always
have low level players trying to be twinked and you will always have
jealous "un-twinked" players. But when did the term "roleplaying game"
turn into "hack and loot"?
